article_title: Harper becomes youngest unanimous MVP winner, takes NL award
article_text: FILE - In this Saturday, June 13, 2015 file photo, Washington Nationals' Bryce Harper hits an RBI single during the sixth inning of a baseball game against the Milwaukee Brewers in Milwaukee. Bryce Harper has become the youngest unanimous MVP winner in baseball history, capturing the NL award during a season in which his Washington Nationals missed the playoffs. Harper got all 30 first-place votes from members of the Baseball Writers' Association of America in results announced Thursday, Nov. 19, 2015. (AP Photo/Morry Gash, File) The Associated Press

og.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Bryce Harper has become the youngest unanimous MVP winner in baseball history, capturing the NL award during a season in which his Washington Nationals missed the playoffs.

article_metadata.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Bryce Harper has become the youngest unanimous MVP winner in baseball history, capturing the NL award during a season in which his Washington Nationals missed the playoffs.

article_summary:
Bryce Harper has become the youngest unanimous MVP winner in baseball history, capturing the NL award during a season in which his Washington Nationals missed the playoffs.
Harper got all 30 first-place votes from members of the Baseball Writers' Association of America in results announced Thursday, Nov. 19, 2015.
FILE - In this Saturday, June 13, 2015 file photo, Washington Nationals' Bryce Harper hits an RBI single during the sixth inning of a baseball game against the Milwaukee Brewers in Milwaukee.
(AP Photo/Morry Gash, File) The Associated Press
